section-block.flip_chart-concept-question: What vehicles do we know about? How do they help us?

flip_chart-centered-content.flip_chart-teacher-facing-paragraph: The wheels on the bus go round and round, [rolling motion, hand over hand] round and round, round and round. The wheels on the bus go round and round, all through the town.

The wings on the plane go swoosh, swoosh, swoosh, [arms outstretched, leaning side to side] swoosh, swoosh, swoosh, swoosh, swoosh, swoosh. The wings on the plane go swoosh, swoosh, swoosh, all through the sky.
The horn on the car goes beep, beep, beep, [push hand down, like honking a horn] beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep. The horn on the car goes beep, beep, beep, all down the street.
The oars on the boat go splash, splash, splash, [rowing motion with arms] splash, splash, splash, splash, splash, splash. The oars on the boat go splash, splash, splash, all across the lake.

The engine on the train goes chug, chug, chug, [hands in fists, making pumping motion back and forth] chug, chug, chug, chug, chug chug. The engine on the train goes chug, chug, chug, on the way to town.
The bucket on the digger goes dig, dig, dig, [palms cupped together, digging] dig, dig, dig, dig, dig, dig. The bucket on the digger goes dig, dig, dig, all around the town.
